summary: This bill, H.R. 361, the "Make Greenland Great Again Act," authorizes the President of the United States to enter into negotiations with the Kingdom of Denmark to acquire the territory of Greenland. The authority for these negotiations would begin on January 20, 2025. If an agreement is reached, the President must transmit it to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs and the Senate Committee on Foreign Relations. The bill provides a 60-day congressional review period, after which the agreement would take effect unless a joint resolution of disapproval is enacted by Congress.
